arts.ttl: 'Next time' – Fabian Hurzeler reacts to boos from Brighton fans after Aston Villa defeat
arts.sum: Some Brighton fans not pleased after FA Cup exit and Aston Villa loss
Aston Villa boss Unai Emery has said Marcus Rashford is "regaining confidence" after he scored again in Wednesday's 3-0 win over Brighton.

arts.ttl: 'Aston Villa bucked the trend in January - and are reaping rewards'
arts.sum: Aston Villa's match-winners against Brighton prove they are reaping the rewards of their January business, writes Phil McNulty.

arts.ttl: PL hits and misses: Villa on the charge as new boys prove worth
arts.sum: Villa have made shrewd decisions in the market and the impact they have had and should continue to have, may be the difference between Emery's side achieving their goals come season's end. It was not a pretty Merseyside derby, they seldom are, but it was a satisfying one for Arne Slot as his Liverpool side put those cup defeats behind them to show their resolve and take a big step towards regaining the Premier League title this season.

arts.ttl: Are Villa starting to get the best out of Rashford?
arts.sum: Match of the Day pundits Joe Hart and Micah Richards praise Aston Villa's winter signings, including Marcus Rashford, after their 3-0 win at Brighton.

arts.ttl: Marcus Rashford is progressively getting better at Aston Villa – Unai Emery
arts.sum: Rashford scored in Villa’s comfortable win against European rivals Brighton.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery sends Marcus Rashford message and explains Ollie Watkins plan moving forward
arts.sum: Marcus Rashford scored his first league goal for Aston Villa against Brighton on Wednesday night Unai Emery sends Marcus Rashford message and explains Ollie Watkins plan moving forward

arts.ttl: ‘Maybe’: Unai Emery makes exciting Marcus Rashford claim after he scores again as a striker for Aston Villa
arts.sum: It’s safe to say that Manchester United loanee Marcus Rashford is reviving his career every single time he steps out onto the pitch for Aston...

arts.ttl: Hurzeler keeps his answers short after Brighton defeat by Villa
arts.sum: Fabian Hurzeler gives a number of short answers in his post-match interview with Match of the Day following Brighton's 3-0 defeat to Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Marcus Rashford and Marco Asensio on target as Aston Villa leapfrog Brighton
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: Fabian Hürzeler has had better weeks. After the agony of being dumped out of the FA Cup quarter-finals on Saturday by Nottingham Forest in a penalty shootout, there was more heartache for the Brighton manager as Marcus Rashford’s third goal in his last two matches, yet another for Marco Asensio and Donyell Malen’s first for the club gave Aston Villa a crucial victory in the battle for a top-five finish. It meant Unai Emery’s side moved above Brighton and vastly improved their chances of matching last season’s achievement of qualifying for the Champions League. They still have to play fourth- and fifth-placed Manchester City and Newcastle in the run-in but after making some shrewd acquisitions in January, including Rashford and Asensio – who now has eight goals for Villa since joining on loan from Paris Saint-Germain – you wouldn’t bet against them doing it. Continue reading...
